Identification
\ProvidesFile{tuenc-greek.def}
[2020/02/28 0.14 Greek LICRs for XeTeX and LuaTeX]

Abstract

Experimental support for Greek LICR macros with XeTeX and LuaTeX. Extends tuenc_. Used by babel-greek and textalpha.

History:

2013-07-16

initial version

0.1.1

bugfix: wrong breathings psilioxia -> dasiaoxia

bugfix: Disable composite defs starting with char macro, fix ‚Äúhiatus‚Äù handling.

fix ‚Äúinput‚Äù path.

0.1.4

remove clashing defs for legacy characters with oxia, fix upcasing of \finalsigma.

fix identification.

Motivation

LICR macro definitions for the Greek script are missing in tuenc_ (as well as the predecessors xunicode, euenc).

This file defines LaTeX Internal Character Representaction (LICR) macros for Greek letters and symbols. It works independed of xunicode using the standard commands for LaTeX2e font selection.

Requirements

Requires XeTeX or LuaTeX, fontspec, and a font with Greek characters.

See tuenc-greek-doc.tex and tuenc-greek-doc.pdf for setup and usage examples.

Greek Diacritics

Define ‚Äúnamed macros‚Äù for simple and combined diacritics.

  • Named accent macros can be used instead of the \@tabacckludge by to-LaTeX converters to ensure working also inside the tabbing environment.

  • Named macros are required for upcasing according to Greek typesetting conventions and in the definition of composite commands.

Greek alias names for standard accents:

\DeclareTextCommand{\acctonos}{\UTFencname}{\@tabacckludge'}
\DeclareTextCommand{\accvaria}{\UTFencname}{\@tabacckludge`}
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdialytika}{\UTFencname}{\@tabacckludge"}

The combining perispomeni character is normalized with Greek base letters, while the (standard) combining tilde is not:

\DeclareTextCommand{\accperispomeni}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0342 }

Breathings:

(The COMBINING GREEK KORONIS is a legacy character, discarded in favour of COMBINING COMMA ABOVE)

\DeclareTextCommand{\accpsili}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0313 } % œàŒπŒªŒÆ spiritus lenis (smooth breathing)
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdasia}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0314 } % Œ¥Œ±œÉŒµ·øñŒ± spiritus asper (rough breathing)

Sub-iota:

\ypogegrammeni is a postfix accent (ligature in LGR)

\DeclareTextSymbol{\ypogegrammeni}{\UTFencname}{0837} % COMBINING GREEK YPOGEGRAMMENI

Combined diacritics:

% The COMBINING DIALYTIKA TONOS is discarded and not well supported by fonts:
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdialytikatonos}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0308 \char"0301 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdialytikavaria}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0308 \char"0300 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdialytikaperispomeni}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0342 \char"0308 }

\DeclareTextCommand{\accdasiaoxia}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0314 \char"0301 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdasiavaria}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0314 \char"0300 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accdasiaperispomeni}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0314 \char"0342 }

\DeclareTextCommand{\accpsilioxia}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0301 \char"0313 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accpsilivaria}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0300 \char"0313 }
\DeclareTextCommand{\accpsiliperispomeni}{\UTFencname}[1]{#1\char"0342 \char"0313 }

Common Definitions

Use the common Greek font encoding definitions:

\renewcommand*{\LastDeclaredEncoding}{\UTFencname}
\input{greek-fontenc.def}

Character Definitions

General Punctuation

Ligature break up with ZERO WIDTH NON-JOINER:

\DeclareTextCommand{\textcompwordmark}{\UTFencname}{\char"200C}

Greek and Coptic

% NR    Unicode Name                                       %   babel name, % PU name
% 0370  GREEK CAPITAL LETTER HETA                          % Õ∞
% 0371  GREEK SMALL LETTER HETA                            % Õ±
% 0372  GREEK CAPITAL LETTER ARCHAIC SAMPI                 % Õ≤
% 0373  GREEK SMALL LETTER ARCHAIC SAMPI                   % Õ≥
\DeclareTextCommand{\textdexiakeraia}{\UTFencname}{Õ¥} % \anwtonos, \textnumeralsigngreek
\DeclareTextCommand{\textaristerikeraia}{\UTFencname}{Õµ} % \katwtonos, \textnumeralsignlowergreek
% 0376  GREEK CAPITAL LETTER PAMPHYLIAN DIGAMMA            % Õ∂
% 0377  GREEK SMALL LETTER PAMPHYLIAN DIGAMMA              % Õ∑

% 037A  GREEK YPOGEGRAMMENI (use \textcompwordmark\ypogegrammeni) % Õ∫
% 037B  GREEK SMALL REVERSED LUNATE SIGMA SYMBOL
% 037C  GREEK SMALL DOTTED LUNATE SIGMA SYMBOL
% 037D  GREEK SMALL REVERSED DOTTED LUNATE SIGMA SYMBOL
\DeclareTextCommand{\texterotimatiko}{\UTFencname}{Õæ} % 037E GREEK QUESTION MARK

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{ŒÑ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikatonos}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{ŒÖ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{ŒÜ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textanoteleia}{\UTFencname}{Œá} % \anoteleia
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textEpsilon}{Œà}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textEta}{Œâ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textIota}{Œä}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textOmicron}{Œå}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textUpsilon}{Œé}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textOmega}{Œè}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikatonos}{\UTFencname}{\textiota}{Œê}

\DeclareTextCommand{\textAlpha}{\UTFencname}{Œë}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textBeta}{\UTFencname}{Œí}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textGamma}{\UTFencname}{Œì}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textDelta}{\UTFencname}{Œî}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textEpsilon}{\UTFencname}{Œï}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textZeta}{\UTFencname}{Œñ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textEta}{\UTFencname}{Œó}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textTheta}{\UTFencname}{Œò}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textIota}{\UTFencname}{Œô}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textKappa}{\UTFencname}{Œö}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textLambda}{\UTFencname}{Œõ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textMu}{\UTFencname}{Œú}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textNu}{\UTFencname}{Œù}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textXi}{\UTFencname}{Œû}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textOmicron}{\UTFencname}{Œü}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textPi}{\UTFencname}{Œ†}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textRho}{\UTFencname}{Œ°}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textSigma}{\UTFencname}{Œ£}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textTau}{\UTFencname}{Œ§}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textUpsilon}{\UTFencname}{Œ•}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textPhi}{\UTFencname}{Œ¶}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textChi}{\UTFencname}{Œß}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textPsi}{\UTFencname}{Œ®}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textOmega}{\UTFencname}{Œ©}

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\"}{\UTFencname}{\textIota}{Œ™}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\"}{\UTFencname}{\textUpsilon}{Œ´}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{Œ¨}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textepsilon}{Œ≠}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\texteta}{ŒÆ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textiota}{ŒØ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikatonos}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{Œ∞}

\DeclareTextCommand{\textalpha}{\UTFencname}{Œ±}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textbeta}{\UTFencname}{Œ≤}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textgamma}{\UTFencname}{Œ≥}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textdelta}{\UTFencname}{Œ¥}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textepsilon}{\UTFencname}{Œµ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarepsilon}{\UTFencname}{Œµ} % cf. $\varepsiolon$
\DeclareTextCommand{\textzeta}{\UTFencname}{Œ∂}
\DeclareTextCommand{\texteta}{\UTFencname}{Œ∑}
\DeclareTextCommand{\texttheta}{\UTFencname}{Œ∏}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textiota}{\UTFencname}{Œπ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textkappa}{\UTFencname}{Œ∫}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textlambda}{\UTFencname}{Œª}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textmu}{\UTFencname}{Œº} % \textmugreek
\DeclareTextCommand{\textnu}{\UTFencname}{ŒΩ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textxi}{\UTFencname}{Œæ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textomicron}{\UTFencname}{Œø}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpi}{\UTFencname}{œÄ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textrho}{\UTFencname}{œÅ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarsigma}{\UTFencname}{œÇ} % final sigma
\DeclareTextCommand{\textfinalsigma}{\UTFencname}{\textvarsigma}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textsigma}{\UTFencname}{œÉ}
% Dummy definition (\textautosigma is lowercase of \textSigma):
\ProvideTextCommand{\textautosigma}{\UTFencname}{\textsigma}
\DeclareTextCommand{\texttau}{\UTFencname}{œÑ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textupsilon}{\UTFencname}{œÖ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textphi}{\UTFencname}{œÜ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarphi}{\UTFencname}{œÜ} % cf. $\varphi$
\DeclareTextCommand{\textchi}{\UTFencname}{œá}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpsi}{\UTFencname}{œà}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textomega}{\UTFencname}{œâ}

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\"}{\UTFencname}{\textiota}{œä}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\"}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{œã}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textomicron}{œå}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{œç}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\'}{\UTFencname}{\textomega}{œé}

\DeclareTextCommand{\textQoppa}{\UTFencname}{œò}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textqoppa}{\UTFencname}{œô}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textStigma}{\UTFencname}{œö}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textstigma}{\UTFencname}{œõ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textDigamma}{\UTFencname}{œú}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textdigamma}{\UTFencname}{œù}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textKoppa}{\UTFencname}{œû} % not defined in LGR
\DeclareTextCommand{\textkoppa}{\UTFencname}{œü} % \koppa, \textqoppa¬†[sic!]
\DeclareTextCommand{\textSampi}{\UTFencname}{œ†}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textsampi}{\UTFencname}{œ°}

% Symbol variants
\DeclareTextCommand{\textbetasymbol}{\UTFencname}{œê}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textkappasymbol}{\UTFencname}{œ∞}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textThetasymbol}{\UTFencname}{œ¥}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textthetasymbol}{\UTFencname}{œë}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textphisymbol}{\UTFencname}{œï}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpisymbol}{\UTFencname}{œñ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textrhosymbol}{\UTFencname}{œ±}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textepsilonsymbol}{\UTFencname}{œµ}
% math compatibility aliases
% $\varphi$ and $\varepsilon$ refer to the letter characters (see above)!
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarbeta}{\UTFencname}{\textbetasymbol}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarkappa}{\UTFencname}{œ∞}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarTheta}{\UTFencname}{œ¥}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvartheta}{\UTFencname}{œë}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarpi}{\UTFencname}{œñ}
\DeclareTextCommand{\textvarrho}{\UTFencname}{œ±}

Greek Extended

We skip definitions for characters ‚Äú‚Ä¶ WITH OXIA‚Äù, because they would overwrite the defintions for ‚Äú‚Ä¶ WITH TONOS‚Äù in the Greek and Coptic block.

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsili}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÄ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasia}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÅ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsilivaria}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÇ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasiavaria}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÉ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsilioxia}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÑ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasiaoxia}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÖ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsiliperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textalpha}{·ºÜ}

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsilivaria}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºä}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasiavaria}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºã}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsilioxia}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºå}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasiaoxia}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºç}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsiliperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºé}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasiaperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textAlpha}{·ºè}

\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikaoxia}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{·ø£}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accpsili}{\UTFencname}{\textrho}{·ø§}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasia}{\UTFencname}{\textrho}{·ø•}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\~}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{·ø¶}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\~}{\UTFencname}{œÖ}{·ø¶}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{·ø¶}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikaperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textupsilon}{·øß}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\u}{\UTFencname}{\textUpsilon}{·ø®}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\=}{\UTFencname}{\textUpsilon}{·ø©}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\`}{\UTFencname}{\textUpsilon}{·ø™}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasia}{\UTFencname}{\textRho}{·ø¨}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikavaria}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{·ø≠}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdialytikaoxia}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{·øÆ}

% ·ø≤
% ·ø≥
% ·ø¥
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\~}{\UTFencname}{\textomega}{·ø∂}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\~}{\UTFencname}{œâ}{·ø∂}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accperispomeni}{\UTFencname}{\textomega}{·ø∂}
% ·ø∑
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\`}{\UTFencname}{\textOmicron}{·ø∏}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\`}{\UTFencname}{\textOmega}{·ø∫}
% ·øº
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accoxia}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{·øΩ}
\DeclareTextCompositeCommand{\accdasia}{\UTFencname}{\textcompwordmark}{·øæ}

Letterlike Symbols

\DeclareTextCommand{\textohm}{\UTFencname}{‚Ñ¶} % OHM SIGN

Ancient Greek Numbers

TODO: map other chars to corresponding Greek letters. See also the grnumalt package.

Definition with literal Unicode characters, because the code-point has 5 hexadecimal digits:

\DeclareTextCommand{\textpentedeka}{\UTFencname}{êÖÑ}    % GREEK ACROPHONIC ATTIC FIFTY
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpentehekaton}{\UTFencname}{êÖÖ} % GREEK ACROPHONIC ATTIC FIVE HUNDRED
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpenteqilioi}{\UTFencname}{êÖÜ}  % GREEK ACROPHONIC ATTIC FIVE THOUSAND
\DeclareTextCommand{\textpentemuria}{\UTFencname}{êÖá}   % GREEK ACROPHONIC ATTIC FIFTY THOUSAND

UPPERCASE

Greek letters drop diacritics (eccept dialytika and sub-iota) in UPPERCASE.

uclclist

The common Greek font encoding definitions in greek-fontenc.def extend the uclclist with Greek LICR macros. Here, we add textkoppa/textKoppa and Unicode-specific ‚Äúhiatus‚Äù handling (copied from lgrenc.def and changed Latin transcription to Unicode literals).

@uclclist extension (see also greek-fontenc.def):

\providecommand*\tuenc@greek@update@uclclist{%
  \expandafter\def\expandafter\@uclclist\expandafter{%
    \@uclclist
    \textkoppa \textKoppa
  }%
  \let\tuenc@greek@update@uclclist\relax
}

Expand the uclc list using the just defined macro:

\tuenc@greek@update@uclclist

Now the hiatus definition modifications:

\DeclareTextCommand{\LGR@A@hiatus}{\UTFencname}{%
  \LGR@ifnextchar{Œô}{\textAlpha\"}{%
    \LGR@ifnextchar{Œ•}{\textAlpha\"}{%
      \LGR@ifnextchar{\textIota}{\textAlpha\"}{%
        \LGR@ifnextchar{\textUpsilon}{\textAlpha\"}{\textAlpha}%
      }%
    }%
  }%
}
\DeclareTextCommand{\LGR@E@hiatus}{\UTFencname}{%
  \LGR@ifnextchar{Œô}{\textEpsilon\"}{%
    \LGR@ifnextchar{Œ•}{\textEpsilon\"}{%
      \LGR@ifnextchar{\textIota}{\textEpsilon\"}{%
        \LGR@ifnextchar{\textUpsilon}{\textEpsilon\"}{\textEpsilon}%
      }%
    }%
  }%
}
